rComments: Allison Gong is a difficult teacher to take, at least over the summer for Marine Biology. She makes you work for your grade, and she makes you prove you really want that grade. I would suggest to anyone to take her during a longer period because she covers an entire textbook in a little less than two months. She is very opinionated and funny.
Worst teacher ever. Hard as heck for a GE class. Tests are ridiculous and majority is not based on taught material. Do not take this class.

Shes a great Profesor. She lectures pretty fast but thats reasonable since she has a lot to cover. She posts the lectures online though so its good. She doesnt use the book a lot and what little of it she does use she puts it on the study guide.

She doesn't post her notes online so make sure to come to class and learn how to take quick notes. The field trips really are fun as it takes you out of your bubble in UCSC & explore more of the city and its beauty. Easy weekly online quizzes. Exams are moderate as they're a mix of short answer questions, fill-in-the-blanks, & mult. choice. Study!

Gong is an informative/interesting teacher, her lectures are organized, and provide all the info you'll need for the midterm/final, but she lectures really fast, so you have to copy them fast. Tests are long, but are do-able if you study all your lecture notes, not just her studyguides. There are a few mandatory but fun fieldtrips also.

She likes to lecture REALLY FAST, but it makes sense cuz u go through almost the whole book in one quarter. I thought it was going to be an easy A class, but it wasn't. I took other science classes before taking this class which helped thank god! Everything is "reasonable," but there is a lot of work & u have to stay on top of it if u want an A

Allison is a great professor.  Tests are reasonable but pretty hard and you definitely have to study, but the topics are interesting.  You can tell she is really passionate about marine life and the way she talks is kinda funny. She says "these guys" a lot and is kinda sassy. She's fun.

She is very enthusiastic about her subject and very knowledgeable! Her test questions are taken directly from her notes, she rarely uses the book, so study from your notes and you will do just fine- I made flashcards from my notes and got an A. She is an amazing professor, I loved her class!

It is a interesting subject, but not as fun as i thought it would be. Definitely study for the midterm and final, they are based on lecture notes. The study guides she provides are really helpful, the book is not needed at all. Labs count a lot, so attend lab and you can pass the class even if you don't do so well in the tests.

She is an awesome teacher!!! She definitely inspired me to explore the sea and become more aware of my contribution to the environment. Super enthusiastic about the material and gives you all the notes you need to know.

She is a really good teacher who knows a lot about the info.she may seem intimidating because she goes quickly through the material. class is not too easy but if you just do your work(because ur in college) its fine.dont need the book.study for finals n midterms straight from notes.man up and take it.very interesting
I do not recommend this class, especially if you are taking it just for a GE and if you are not a science-y person. It is not as fun as it sounds, and it is way too time-consuming for a GE.
DOn't take this class, she goes to fast through her notes and her test are difficult and the study guides only ask you what ISN'T going to be on the test.

Gong was really organized, everything is in power point, which makes it really easy to take notes. She could be really blunt and come off as mean sometimes, but she was generally really pleasant, and I learned a lot in the class. I recommend it if you need the GE's.

Gong is alright, she can be really scary during lecture, and is not very approachable during that time.  However, on the field trips I was able to have a short, yet pleasant conversation with her.  The class was pretty easy, just go to lecture copy the slides, she talks fast and does not allow laptops.  FOLLOW THE STUDY GUIDES!!!

YOu would assume that this class would be interesting i mean the ocean is a big place but she RUINS it....you can tell she doesn't want to be there and she can be very condescending...remember there are two hydrogens and one oxygen in water! there was no homework which was nice but her lectures went fast adn they are extremely boring!

LOT OF WORK. Need to go to class to pass, I didn't open the book once, all of her test questions come from her lectures. Can fall behind pretty easily if you slack. I get the vibe that she doesnt like teaching...she also says the word "die" every lecture.
One word: BEEZY
Easy class with no HW.  Talks really fast and it makes it hard to take notes.  She doesn't allow laptops in lectures.

It is true you don't need the book.  Information is very elementary (she felt she had to tell us gills don't work outside of water), but she makes lectures pretty mandatory with attendance checks twice a week.  Field trips are cool, but I didn't learn anything about the subject.

Allison is a hard ass, but if you are willing to work it is pretty clear what you need to do to do well. She gives clear notes, is passionate about her subject. Always go to to class, you'll never have to read the book.

Every fact you need for tests is written on the board. Gong has the personality and humor of a starfish. She is very left-brained and unremarkable and the class is extremely straight-forward. Gong is not very enlightening, but this site is concerned with helpfulness and clarity, which she excels in.

Her lectures are clear and consise but very boring!! Although the midterms are straight from her lectures, they are very detailed! The midterms are also graded by a very hard grader not the TA's so keep that in mind.

You guys are crazy. The material is straight forward, but she's boring.  She writes the lecture notes on the board so there's absolutely no independant thought.  Maybe she's good compared to high school crap where they treat you like children, but compared to ANYTHING else she's terrible.

DO NOT BE FOOLED! This class appears to be very easy, but her midterms are insanely detailed. She was happy because the average was a 73 on the last one. Just study your ass off for her tests or you will find yourself trapped in the C range for the rest of the quarter.

Great lecturer!  Lectures can get kind of boring but she tells you EXACTLY what you need to know for the tests!  She is also very organized in the way she runs the class!  I would highly recommend taking this class if you like marine biology without the math behind it!
I hated the class because of her. Yes, she makes it easy by writing out all of the notes.... but it was one of the most boring classes I have taken. The Gong. Not a fan.
Wonderufl lectures, she write out the notes as you do making it extremely easy to follow along, will stop for any questions you may have.
She is a pretty good professor.  The thing that I don't like about that class is that she treats her students like they are little kids and she doesn't use technical terms.  The class is easy though.
i think if you are interested in the course, you will enjoy the class. however, her midterms were too detailed, but the labs were extremely easy and fun.

Gong is a MEAN MEAN RUDE Professor. She don't care for the students. And she thinks she is special because she is a biologist. If you have a choice take it with Mary Silver, NOT Gong. And you don't need the book, just the lecture notes and you will do fine

it's true that you don't need the book. i tried studying from it without her notes and died on the enduring midterms. the only thing i remembered from the book is that humpback whales like to have threesomes. she doesn't care about any student and i doodled throughout her lecturing. labs are pointless but confusing sometimes, and trips are fun.

If you take the life in the sea class, it isn't as easy as it may seem. DEF go to all classes and use the lecture notes for a reference. I learned the hard way by missing 3 classes I missed 2 quizzes and one attendence check... not the best idea in the world. You really need to study for this class thats all I have to say.

I am a Marine Biology major so I took this class wanting to get some basic, introductory information. Gong was very feisty, wore denim on denim, and overall led a very clear class. She does not expect much from her students, but the material doesn't expect much either - I felt like I was watching Animal Planet in her classes. Take it, it's fun!

This is an easy class, but Gong does seem like she just wants to get it over with. Class is very basic, with easy and pointless labs (they never take the full time). Tests are based on her notes so no need to buy the book. Buy the right clicker for her quizzes and attendance checks.

She is a mean person who does not seem to like teaching the class she does. The class overall is very easy but she treats it like middle school. The subject is very interesting, but she ruins the class. Take this class if you feel like doing many assignments that are a waste of time and pointless to learning

Allison is not a nice person in fact she is the meanest professor I have ever had. She is really rude and you can tell that she would rather be doing something else. You don't need the book just memorize her notes, but beware Gong is MEAN!!!

Life in the sea is an easy class and Gong was very clear. She told you exactly what you needed to know and the tests had absolutely no surprises on them. Her powerpoints had all the information and the tests were fairly easy. She was pretty rude and looked angry if you asked questions or tried to clarify. She also made really bad analogies.

Prof. Gong is highly organized and she is very clear on what you need to know for the exams. However, she is not always fair when it comes to giving out extra credits. I recommend taking her courses if you don't like Prof. Silver (also a prof. for this course) because they have very opposite styles when it comes to teaching.

Life in the sea was a relatively interesting, but remedial class. If you attend lectures every day, you'll have everything you need to know for the tests. It's a little tricky though because there's A LOT of material on the tests.

Very easy class.  Tests are tricky but study guides help a lot, and the lectures cover everything you need to know.  The book is expensive and unnecessary.  She (however) is pretty cold-hearted, unfair, and unfriendly, and couldn't care less about her students.

She seemed like she wanted to hear herself teach, rather than make sure that the students got what she was teaching.  She went through lecture slides way too fast, and if someone asked her to go back to a slide for a second, she would either do it and act annoyed, or not go back at all. Trips fun, good info, needs better teaching.

Her lectures are very clear and simple, and she writes the notes she wants you to know directly on the board. Honestly the class seemed a little TOO basic at times, and I am terrible with the sciences. She herself is not the most approachable, but the TA's a very helpful and available for questions.

v. easy even if you arent science major.Her lectures are everything you need for the tests-GO TO CLASS & don't buy the book.Tests easy: read your notes. my main problem with allison was she didnt care if students had a problem, ie bubble in wrong test form, & will not go out of way to help you at all. if you have problem, go to your ta, not her.
Not the best teacher, but very informative. kinda interesting. Itching the TA is awsome, get him if you can

her notes are all written on the board, hushes students when they are talking (a bit too elementary), midterms and finals are a bit hard but there is study guides to help. field trips are a lot of fun and the labs are awesome and easy. itchung (TA) great guy, fun class and interesting overall

good lecture slides and info, interesting stuff. good teacher, not too boring. shes very interested in her work so keep up. study enough for the midterm and final (details in book and lecture notes). Great LAB time!
She makes not taking easy; she is a good lecturer...

I never once opened my $150 book...lectures are dull but everything is included, study guides can be misleading but if you study youll do well. My only problem is I had taken oceanography before & her general info about it wasnt correct and she couldnt answer questions about it. (if you cant answer questions, you shouldnt be teaching the material!)

This class was so much fun! Her lectures are very clear and she writes everything you need to know on the board. Field trips are cool, and labs are cool too. very easy class and fun. Take it with Allison!
